post: Building AI applications that deliver real business value requires strong architectural foundations. In this guide, we break down the core patterns used by leading companies to implement production AI - from retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for knowledge-intensive applications to strategic model fine-tuning for specialized use cases. Whether you're a data leader exploring AI transformation or an engineer implementing your first AI pipeline, you'll learn the key approaches for structuring maintainable, production-ready AI systems.Discover how to evaluate and select the right pattern for your use case, implement it effectively using modern orchestration tools like Dagster, and avoid common pitfalls in production AI deployments. The future of software is AI-enabled - get the architectural blueprint you need to build it today.hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#mlops hashtag#ai hashtag#artificailintelligence

post: Are your enterprise RAG systems keeping up with modern demands? Today's organizations need more than just basic retrieval-augmented generation.Here, I break down:üîπ Why traditional RAG isn't enough anymore üîπ How multi-modal retrieval is changing the game üîπ Real implementation challenges (and how to solve them) üîπ The future of self-optimizing systemsWhether you're a technical lead, AI architect, or decision-maker in enterprise AI, this will help you understand where retrieval systems are heading ‚Äì and how to stay ahead.

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems are continuing to make massive advancements!I am SUPER excited to publish the 114th Weaviate Podcast with Amanpreet Singh from Contextual AI! This podcast dives into the transformation of RAG architectures from disjoint components to jointly and continually optimized systems.Our conversation dives deep into the vision behind RAG 2.0 -- and why current RAG implementations resemble a "Frankenstein" design of naively gluing together retrieval models, generators, and external tools without proper integration. While functional, this method struggles with integrating domain-specific knowledge, requiring constant prompt engineering maintenance in production environments, as well as more technical concepts such as parametric knowledge conflicts.Amanpreet discusses the fundamental perspectives of RAG 2.0, how it has evolved with tool use, and other fundamental concepts such as the details behind Reinforcement Learning for optimizing LLMs! Amanpreet also explained many of the innovations from Contextual AI such as KTO, APO, LMUnit evals, and the launch of the Contextual AI Platform! I really hope you enjoy the podcast!

How LLM distillation helps to compress a LLM into a smaller, efficient version, enabling operation on low-end devices by reducing computational demands while maintaining performance.---LLM distillation is a process that transfers knowledge from a large, complex model ("teacher") to a smaller, more efficient model ("student"). This method ensures that the student model retains essential capabilities while improving efficiency, speed, and accessibility.Key Benefits========Reduced Model Size ‚Äì Optimized for storage and performance.Improved Inference Speed ‚Äì Enables real-time applications.Lower Computational Costs ‚Äì Reduces energy and hardware requirements.Broader Accessibility ‚Äì Facilitates deployment on mobile and edge devices.Applications========Education ‚Äì Powers personalized learning and tutoring systems through locally installed language models in low-end smartphones.Chatbots ‚Äì Faster and more responsive AI-driven customer support.Implementation Process================Data Preparation ‚Äì Curate a representative dataset for training.Teacher Model Selection ‚Äì Choose a high-performing pre-trained model.Distillation Process ‚Äì Train the student model using soft targets (probability distributions from the teacher model).Evaluation Metrics ‚Äì Assess accuracy, speed, model size, and efficiency.Distillation Techniques===============Knowledge Distillation (KD) ‚Äì Transfers knowledge using probability distributions.Intermediate Layer Distillation ‚Äì Extracts insights from multiple layers of the teacher model.Multi-Teacher Distillation ‚Äì Utilizes multiple teacher models for enriched learning.Data Augmentation ‚Äì Enhances training with diverse data samples.Challenges and Solutions=================Knowledge Loss ‚Äì Mitigated through intermediate layer distillation and data augmentation.Hyperparameter Tuning ‚Äì Requires careful adjustment of temperature settings and learning rates.Continuous Evaluation ‚Äì Regular testing ensures optimal performance.Future Directions===========Progressive Distillation ‚Äì Gradual knowledge transfer for improved learning.Task-Agnostic Distillation ‚Äì Generalization across multiple domains.Cross-Modal Distillation ‚Äì Handling multiple input types, such as text, images, and audio.Zero-Shot and Few-Shot Learning ‚Äì Enhancing adaptability with minimal task-specific training data.LLM distillation is a transformative approach that enhances the efficiency and accessibility of large AI models. By refining knowledge transfer techniques, the AI community is making significant strides toward faster, cheaper, and more scalable language models that can be deployed across various industries. Continued research and innovation will further optimize and expand the applicability of LLM distillation in the future.hashtag#GenerativeAI hashtag#LLM hashtag#AI hashtag#ML

üí¨  The game-changing use case for AI/LLMs in education isn‚Äôt chatbots. Struggling students often don‚Äôt know what questions to ask‚Äîor even what they don‚Äôt know. We need to embed support directly into curricular activities, providing guidance in the right context, at the right moment.To that point: the goal also isn't to figure out how to place AI in curricula, it's only useful as much as it serves us reaching pedagogical best practices. We should look for areas where research-based practices are not happening during real world implementation, perhaps because they are not feasible for 25 students at once in class, and note where an LLM could fill those gaps (while being realistic about its limitations).Please start with the use case/need before you start with the AI! üôè

ùêÜùê®ùê®ùê†ùê•ùêû ùêìùê¢ùê≠ùêöùêß: ùêìùê°ùêû ùêãùêãùêå ùêÅùê´ùêûùêöùê§ùê≠ùê°ùê´ùê®ùêÆùê†ùê° ùêàùêßùê¨ùê©ùê¢ùê´ùêûùêù ùêõùê≤ ùêáùêÆùê¶ùêöùêß ùêÇùê®ùê†ùêßùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêöùêßùêù ùêåùêûùê¶ùê®ùê´ùê≤Google recently published a concept paper on ùëªùíäùíïùíÇùíè, a breakthrough in LLM architecture.If you‚Äôve ever used an LLM like ChatGPT, you know they‚Äôre incredibly powerful‚Äîbut they have a major flaw. Based on ùëªùíìùíÇùíèùíîùíáùíêùíìùíéùíÜùíì architecture they‚Äôre like ùíëùíìùíäùíèùíïùíÜùíÖ ùíÉùíêùíêùíåùíî‚Äîfull of knowledge but unable to learn and adapt once published. They process short-term data well, but ask them to remember a conversation from months ago? That‚Äôs where they struggle.But our brains? We‚Äôve evolved a brilliant hack‚Äîstoring information in short-term, long-term, and working memory. We don‚Äôt clutter our minds with unnecessary details (you remember your first day at work, but do you recall last week‚Äôs lunch?).Now, Google Titan is bringing this concept to AI.Titan doesn‚Äôt just process data; it remembers, prioritizes, and forgets‚Äîjust like we do. It organizes knowledge into memory buckets and applies a ‚ÄúùíîùíñùíìùíëùíìùíäùíîùíÜ ùíéùíÜùíïùíìùíäùíÑ‚Äù to retain only high-value insights. Outdated or irrelevant data naturally fades away through ùíÇùíÖùíÇùíëùíïùíäùíóùíÜ ùíáùíêùíìùíàùíÜùíïùíïùíäùíèùíà.Why does this matter?Titan moves AI beyond static models, taking us one step closer to AGI. Here‚Äôs what it is already doing:üí¨ ùêÅùê´ùêûùêöùê§ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùêÆùêßùê¢ùêúùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêõùêöùê´ùê´ùê¢ùêûùê´ùê¨: Real-time translations and smart chatbots are connecting people from different cultures like never before.üìö ùêåùêöùê§ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê•ùêûùêöùê´ùêßùê¢ùêßùê† ùêûùêöùê¨ùê¢ùêûùê´: Personalized AI tutors bring education to your fingertips, no matter where you are.üí° ùêÅùê®ùê®ùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêùùêÆùêúùê≠ùê¢ùêØùê¢ùê≠ùê≤: From summarizing reports to writing code, these tools handle the boring stuff so we can focus on being creative.üåü ùêÖùêÆùêûùê•ùê•ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêúùê´ùêûùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêØùê¢ùê≠ùê≤:¬†Writers, developers, and artists are teaming up with AI to create new ideas, designs, and tools.It‚Äôs exciting to think about what‚Äôs next. A world where we can work, learn, and connect without limits.But have you ever wondered ‚Äî how do these models actually work? What makes them so intelligent? It all started with the paper "ùêÄùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê¢ùê¨ ùêöùê•ùê• ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùêßùêûùêûùêù" by Vaswani and his team published in 2017. They introduced the ùòÅùóøùóÆùóªùòÄùó≥ùóºùóøùó∫ùó≤ùóø architecture, a revolutionary approach to processing and understanding large datasets efficiently. The secret? ùêíùêûùê•ùêü-ùêöùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê¶ùêûùêúùê°ùêöùêßùê¢ùê¨ùê¶ùê¨, which allow AI to focus on the most important parts of the input‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a single word or an entire document.üëâ Want to see transformers in action? I‚Äôve put together a hands-on breakdown in my GitHub repository: üîóhttps://lnkd.in/geTTwcm8 , Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find:üìå ùêëùêûùêØùêûùê´ùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêö ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùêù ùêÆùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêö ùê≠ùê´ùêöùêßùê¨ùêüùê®ùê´ùê¶ùêûùê´ ùê¶ùê®ùêùùêûùê•: A simple yet powerful way to understand how transformers process sequences and learn patterns.üìå ùêìùê´ùêöùêßùê¨ùê•ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê¨ùêûùêßùê≠ùêûùêßùêúùêûùê¨ ùêüùê´ùê®ùê¶ ùêÑùêßùê†ùê•ùê¢ùê¨ùê° ùê≠ùê® ùêíùê∞ùêûùêùùê¢ùê¨ùê°:¬†See how transformers handle language translation, capturing context and nuances better than traditional models.These examples provide a practical introduction to how transformers work under the hood. Whether you're new to AI or diving deeper, I'd love to hear your thoughts ‚Äî where do you think AI is heading next?

Most AI tutors just give answers.Bloom AI Tutor does something different‚Äîit guides students to think critically.Instead of simply providing solutions, Bloom asks the right questions at the right time, helping students work through problems step by step. It‚Äôs designed to think like a great teacher, not just retrieve information.It's made possible through our multi-layer AI architecture, which chains together multiple AI models to ensure accuracy, relevance and pedagogical soundness. Prompt engineering is built-in and pedagogically aligned.AI in education can either replace thinking or deepen learning‚Äîwe‚Äôre building for the latter. Reach out if you want to see it in action.

Harvard says AI tutors are better than Harvard professors. A recent study showed Harvard undergrads improved their physics scores 2x as much with an AI tutor than in an active-learning lecture. What are the implications?Students engaging with AI tutors learn more and in far less time. This holds true when compared to the previous gold standard in classroom instruction: active learning (peer instruction, small-group activities, flipped classrooms).The 1-on-1 tutor finding is not new. Bloom's Two Sigma Problem found that the average student tutored 1-to-1 using mastery learning performed two standard deviations higher than students educated in a classroom environment.This is why so many people are excited about AI in education ‚Äì¬†it can provide everyone with a 1-to-1 tutor that adapts instruction to exactly what each student needs.My Take: I'm cautiously optimistic. It's so hard to implement technology in the classroom that meaningfully improves learning outcomes at scale. AI tutors may supercharge learning for the self-motivated student. However, most students will not engage with AI tutors correctly and meaningfully without oversight and being held accountable. There will always be a role for human teachers/tutors.I will say that if we figure out AI tutors, the whole learning system will be upended. Classtime will need to further focus on implementing what students learn in more challenging situations to build critical thinking and problem solving skills. At least kids won't fall asleep during lectures in the AI tutor future.What's your take on Harvard's AI tutor finding or the future of AI tutors in general?--Study URL: https:// www. researchsquare. com/article/rs-4243877/v1

Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming education, but US public schools face significant challenges in preparing students for the AI-powered future. To equip learners with the technical skills, digital literacy, critical thinking abilities, and interpersonal competencies needed to thrive in an AI-driven world, schools must thoughtfully integrate AI tools and concepts into curricula, pedagogy, and operations. However, obstacles abound, from the high costs of implementation to the gaping digital divide to the lack of teacher training and ethical guardrails.This article provides a comprehensive roadmap for schools navigating the AI revolution. It explores cost-effective strategies like pursuing grants and partnerships, prioritizing open-source tools, and phasing rollouts. It emphasizes the importance of building capacity through robust teacher professional development and student AI literacy initiatives. Most importantly, it argues for putting ethics and equity at the center of AI integration efforts to ensure all learners benefit. While the path forward is challenging, the potential of AI to create more engaging, effective, and equitable learning experiences is immense for schools willing to dream big and act boldly.hashtag#AIinEducation hashtag#FutureofLearning hashtag#DigitalEquity hashtag#21stCenturySkills hashtag#EthicalAI

How LLM distillation helps to compress a LLM into a smaller, efficient version, enabling operation on low-end devices by reducing computational demands while maintaining performance.---LLM distillation is a process that transfers knowledge from a large, complex model ("teacher") to a smaller, more efficient model ("student"). This method ensures that the student model retains essential capabilities while improving efficiency, speed, and accessibility.Key Benefits========Reduced Model Size ‚Äì Optimized for storage and performance.Improved Inference Speed ‚Äì Enables real-time applications.Lower Computational Costs ‚Äì Reduces energy and hardware requirements.Broader Accessibility ‚Äì Facilitates deployment on mobile and edge devices.Applications========Education ‚Äì Powers personalized learning and tutoring systems through locally installed language models in low-end smartphones.Chatbots ‚Äì Faster and more responsive AI-driven customer support.Implementation Process================Data Preparation ‚Äì Curate a representative dataset for training.Teacher Model Selection ‚Äì Choose a high-performing pre-trained model.Distillation Process ‚Äì Train the student model using soft targets (probability distributions from the teacher model).Evaluation Metrics ‚Äì Assess accuracy, speed, model size, and efficiency.Distillation Techniques===============Knowledge Distillation (KD) ‚Äì Transfers knowledge using probability distributions.Intermediate Layer Distillation ‚Äì Extracts insights from multiple layers of the teacher model.Multi-Teacher Distillation ‚Äì Utilizes multiple teacher models for enriched learning.Data Augmentation ‚Äì Enhances training with diverse data samples.Challenges and Solutions=================Knowledge Loss ‚Äì Mitigated through intermediate layer distillation and data augmentation.Hyperparameter Tuning ‚Äì Requires careful adjustment of temperature settings and learning rates.Continuous Evaluation ‚Äì Regular testing ensures optimal performance.Future Directions===========Progressive Distillation ‚Äì Gradual knowledge transfer for improved learning.Task-Agnostic Distillation ‚Äì Generalization across multiple domains.Cross-Modal Distillation ‚Äì Handling multiple input types, such as text, images, and audio.Zero-Shot and Few-Shot Learning ‚Äì Enhancing adaptability with minimal task-specific training data.LLM distillation is a transformative approach that enhances the efficiency and accessibility of large AI models. By refining knowledge transfer techniques, the AI community is making significant strides toward faster, cheaper, and more scalable language models that can be deployed across various industries. Continued research and innovation will further optimize and expand the applicability of LLM distillation in the future.hashtag#GenerativeAI hashtag#LLM hashtag#AI hashtag#ML

üìö Dive into the World of Large Language Models (LLMs)A good book on Large Language Models (LLMs)‚Äîa comprehensive and thought-provoking resource that explores these transformative technologies in depth.üîë Key Takeaways from the Book:Technical Foundations: A deep dive into the architectures that power LLMs, including Transformers and their advancements.Training and Scaling: Insights into the techniques that make training massive LLMs feasible and their optimization for real-world applications.Applications Across Domains: From revolutionizing healthcare and finance to enhancing education and creative industries, this book provides a clear picture of LLM potential.Ethical Dimensions: An honest look at the challenges around biases, fairness, and responsible AI deployment.The Future of LLMs: A forward-thinking discussion on how these models will shape technology, business, and society in the coming years.Whether you're an AI researcher, practitioner, policymaker, or enthusiast, this publication offers valuable perspectives and cutting-edge knowledge.üîó Read it here: Large Language Models Publication on Arxiv https://lnkd.in/dabNKwhQLet‚Äôs start a conversation: What excites or concerns you most about the rise of LLMs?hashtag#ArtificialIntelligence hashtag#LLMs hashtag#AIResearch hashtag#Innovation hashtag#EmergingTech

Call for Papers: Generative AI and Large Language Models for Computing and STEM EducationSpringer-Nature Discover Artificial IntelligenceSubmission deadline: 31 December 2023This proposed Topical Collection explores the impact of Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLM) on computing and engineering education, investigating their potential to enhance and transform teaching and learning. The Topical Collection seeks original research, case studies, and reviews on the ethical considerations and responsible deployment of these technologies in the classroom for computing and engineering education.Topics:‚Ä¢ Computing and Engineering Education in the AI Era‚Ä¢ Generative AI and LLMs for Intelligence Augmentation‚Ä¢ Generative AI and LLMs for Formative Feedback‚Ä¢ Generative AI and LLMs for Virtual Tutors‚Ä¢ Generative AI and LLMs for Automated Assessment‚Ä¢ Generative AI and LLMs for Scalable Learning‚Ä¢ Ethics of Generative AI and LLMs in Educational Settings‚Ä¢ Privacy Risks and Solutions with Generative AI and LLMs in Educational Settings‚Ä¢ Curricular Changes for the AI EraEditors: Junaid Qadir Ala Al-Fuqaha Muhammad Ali Imran, FIEEE, FRSE, FRSA, FIET, FEAI, SFHEA, CEng. Kok-Lim Alvin YauKeywords:¬†Computing Education; Engineering Education; Generative AI; Large Language Models (LLMs)

"65% of today's students will work in jobs that don't exist yet‚Äîour K-12 system isn't ready."The U.S. K-12 education system stands at a critical crossroads as artificial intelligence transforms our economy and workforce. While 65% of today's primary school students will work in jobs that don't yet exist, our educational institutions remain tethered to outdated practices that prioritize standardized testing over the critical thinking and technological literacy essential for success in an AI-driven future.This systemic failure demands immediate action. Our analysis reveals that only 51% of schools in low-income areas have the high-speed internet necessary for AI tools, creating a devastating digital divide. To maintain America's global competitiveness and ensure equitable opportunities, we must revolutionize K-12 education through comprehensive AI literacy programs, enhanced teacher training, and modernized infrastructure that reaches all communities.hashtag#FutureOfEducation hashtag#ArtificialIntelligence hashtag#K12Education hashtag#EdTech hashtag#DigitalEquity

Infrastructure is the backbone of modern education. The rapid evolution of AI, AR, and VR in education requires robust and reliable connectivity solutions. Students training on virtual welding simulators need low-latency networks. Healthcare students practicing procedures in AR environments depend on stable connections. Advanced manufacturing programs rely on secure data transmission between equipment.Every learning program deserves a strong technological foundation. Educational institutions should consider building their technology strategy on a foundation of reliable infrastructure. This enables them to adapt quickly as new training tools emerge. To ensure that hands-on, immersive learning prepares students for future careers, educators must build sophisticated networks that can handle complex data streams.The future workforce needs both technical skills and practical experience. Modern infrastructure makes this possible, leaving educators to focus on what matters most: preparing students for success in tomorrow's workplace.
